title: In the 1930s, before the term 'teenager' came to use, were 13-year-olds children or adults? - Quora
tags: History of the United States of America

response.answer_text: You were considered a child or young adolescent depending on whether they were showing signs of puberty, as is the case today. Just because the word “teenager” didn’t exist doesn’t mean similar concepts didn’t. Adolescence is a biological stage that is not difficult to observe. The concept of a period between childhood and adulthood goes back to ancient times and was a notable and fetishized stage of life for Ancient Greek boys Ephebos - Wikipedia.

After puberty, or if you had taken on adult responsibilities such as moving out and becoming independent, or keeping your family together after the death of your parents, you were considered adult. Prior to that you were considered a child.
